bio: National Geographic Photographer// Speaker// Workshop Leader// Sony Artisan// Baseball Fan @cubalovesbaseball

list.comment:
Sometimes when you go out shooting at sunrise you find the unexpected. I was heading to the famous Charles Bridge at 6am here in Prague when I saw a couple having their wedding photos taken. The bride must have been freezing in her dress! It was really dark so I turned my ISO up to 10,000. I grabbed a couple of quick shots and continued on to the bridge. That evening I was looking through my images and discovered that I had caught the wedding photographer’s flash going off - which created a beautiful light for me. Of course if I tried to shoot when his flash was going off I would never get it - being lucky is good. Thanks to the other photographer for the unexpected assist!!
-
-
-
#prague #czechrepublic #wedding #flash #sonya7riii #bealpha

A bit of snow and sleet in New York City today, enough to knock over a tree in my neighborhood. The owner of this car will certainly be a bit surprised. If it wasn't so miserable out I would wait around for the owner to show up - just to catch the reaction. Though it may not be until tomorrow. It is always sad to lose a tree in New York😑 @natgeo @thephotosociety -
-
-
#snow #snowstorm #chelsesa #newyorkcity #tree #fallentree #car

A boat makes it way along the Vltava River on a fall afternoon in Prague. The river is the longest in the Czech Republic. -
-
#prague #czechrepublic #autumn #fall #vltava #boat #river #irablock

See my Instagram story about my weekend trip around Manhattan Island on FDNY Fireboat Marine 1, number 343. The number 343 represents the 343 firefighters who perished in the September 11th attacks. Marine 1 is the largest fireboat in the USA, and it can pump 50,000 gallons of water a minute - as a comparison a modern firetruck can do about 17,000 gallons a minute. The boat was designed to detect and protect firefighters from chemical, biological, radiological and nuclear agents. @natgeo @thephotosociety @natgeofineart .
-
-
-
#marine1 #fdny #fireboat #hudsonriver #fireboat343

The Empire State building looms in the background on a cold night in New York as a Con Edison crew engulfed in steam works on lower Fifth Avenue. @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @thephotosociety .
-
-
-
#steam #conedison #fifthavenue #empirestatebuilding #bealpha

The full moon rises over Prague, Czech Republic. I was shooting the Charles Bridge from the Old Town bridge tower when someone said that the full moon was rising on the other side. I was a few minutes late, the moon would have been better lower and bigger. I also was reprimanded by the security for using my mini tripod on the ledge. Sometimes you take what you can get. @thephotosociety @natgeoimagecollection @natgeo -
-
#moon #fullmoon #prague #charlesbridge #bealpha #sonya7riii

Political commentary is not my forte. But as a documentary photographer, I cannot ignore the human condition. I have seen the displaced and disposed throughout the world. Suffering is universal. This photograph was taken in New York City, two blocks from my home.
Tomorrow is election day. Your vote can facilitate change and make a difference. Please exercise your right and vote. DON'T EVER GIVE UP. .
.
#noexcuses #voteforchange

A fire eater performs at the Old Town Square in Prague, Czech Republic. The square is a gathering place for many street artists who perform for the crowds of tourists who visit the Old Town. Needless to say - ‘don’t try this at home’. Fire eating is a complicated and dangerous art form. @thephotosociety @natgeo .
.
.
#fireeating #streetperformer #prague #oldtownsquare #donttrythisathome

My book on the culture of baseball and the Cuban people, Cuba Loves Baseball – A Photographic Journey, is available on Amazon. Follow the link in my bio to purchase a copy. To make this project a reality took over two years and 5 trips. I’m grateful to Bob Costas for writing the most poetic and meaningful foreword, and to Sigfredo Barros a great baseball writer from Cuba for his insights into the history and culture of the sport. Baseball in Cuba is almost as old as baseball in the United States. The oldest professional stadium is in Matanzas, Cuba – the first professional game was played there in 1874, and the stadium is still in use today. If you love travel, baseball Cuba or photography It is a terrific gift for the holidays.
-
-
#baseball #cuba #beisbol #travel #photography #cubalovesbaseball @cubalovesbaseball

Walking through my neighborhood in Chelsea, New York I'm still finding trees that have been seriously damaged from last weeks snowstorm. This beautiful tree is on the grounds of a seminary. One of the large branches ripped a section out of its trunk when the weight of the snow broke it off the tree. I hope the tree survives the extensive damage.
-
-
#tree #storm #chelsea
